about.info: Our database of resources benefits from information collected by these organizations:
about.title: About this site

front-page.p2a: We provide information on school meal sites in the Bay Area, updated every two weeks.
front-page.p2b: Soon, we will also include updated information on free food, legal aid, cash assistance, medical and mental health, child care, domestic violence support, housing, and COVID-19 testing resources. These categories are a work-in-progress! We are working with our partners to bring together the best available information, keep it current, and share it in the most simple, helpful way.
front-page.p3: Start by selecting where you are and what you're looking for.

p4.text: We are affiliated with Stanford's {0} and {1} and are extremely grateful to Bill Behrman, Sara Altman, and Cheryl Phillips for their ongoing support and advice.

about.about-us-sources:
Our database of information benefits from data collected by the following organizations:
USDA SNAP Store locator
USDA WIC Store locator
Second Harvest of Silicon Valley
Stanford Pediatric Advocacy

We have a team of amazing volunteers who verify the data and collect any additional information such as additional Covid-19 senior hours, safe curbside pick-up options etc.
about.about-us-disclaimer: This Bay Area Resources project is purely volunteer-driven. We have a team of humans collecting and verifying data from diverse sources. We do our best to keep all the information on the site as up-to-date as possible, however we cannot guarantee that the information is 100% accurate.

p1.text: Everyone should have access to reliable information on local community resources, in their language, on a simple, accessible platform.

p2.text: BayAreaCommunity.org is a community-driven project that works with local organizations to collect, update, and centralize trustworthy information on community services. We share this information with organizations, social workers, and Bay Area residents seeking resources through a mobile-friendly, multilingual website.

p3.text: We are a project of the organization {0}, a food action collaborative led by students and recent-graduates fighting food insecurity in the US.

school-meals.title: School Meals:
school-meals.subtitle: BayAreaCommunity.org (BAC) maps every school meal site in the 9 Bay Area counties, and updates every two weeks.

our-story.p1: We began in March 2020, when COVID-19 school closures threatened to deprive many families of daily school meals. Mobilizing, the USDA allowed school districts to serve not only students in their district, but all children, at flexible service times and locations. These times and locations, however, changed frequently, and there was no single, reliable resource to help families across the Bay Area find out where meals were available. In response, our team of Stanford students and alumni used Google MyMaps to create and update a simple bilingual Bay Area school meals map that worked for phones.

p2.text: Within two weeks, our map received half a million views. School district websites displayed our site, and we were featured in {0}, {1}, {2}, {3}, {4}, {5}, {6}, {7}, and {8}. We partnered with {9} to update {10} for Stanford Hospital’s low-income patients, and distributed them to partners and counties. We began supplying our school meals data to No Kid Hungry’s {11}. The UC Nutrition Policy Institute and Nourish CA leveraged our data to advocate for expanding school meal funding, child nutrition benefits, and USDA school meal waivers. Since May, we have been advised by Anne Moertel, Public Information Officer for San Francisco Unified School District’s (SFUSD) Student Nutrition Services.

our-story.p3: Ten dedicated volunteers update our school meals database every two weeks, by checking school district websites and social media pages, and calling districts. We conduct monthly data quality audits to ensure we continue to provide Bay Area families with accurate, updated, accessible information.

building-beyond.title: Building Beyond School Meals:
building-beyond.subtitle: As we continue to update and share our school meals database, we are working with our partners to provide information beyond school meals, including other free food resources, food-stamp-accepting stores and farmers’ markets, healthcare, cash assistance, housing, childcare, technology, legal aid, and more.

our-story.p4: Our local partners, their social worker staff, and the residents they support have shown us the importance of accurate, multilingual, accessible community resource information. Unlike with school meals, which required building our own database from scratch, many local organizations are already working to track and share updated information on other community resources, but need support in ensuring their resources remain up-to-date.
our-story.p6: Volunteering directly for other organizations to help update their resource databases, maps, and websites.
our-story.p7: Bringing together updated information from different organizations across the Bay Area to a centralized, multi-resource, and free database.
our-story.p8: Sharing this information with individuals seeking resources and providing referrals through our mobile-friendly website, using human-centered design informed by local social workers and residents.

info-sources.p1: Our database of information benefits from data collected by the following sources:
info-sources.p2: We have a team of amazing volunteers who verify the data and collect any additional information such as additional Covid-19 senior hours, safe curbside pick-up options etc.

info-source.link6: County of Alameda COVID-19 Food Distribution, Testing, and Services Map
info-source.link7: Contra Costa County COVID-19 Food Distribution Map

p2.text: URISA's GISCorps, Coders Against COVID ({0}), and Esri, 2020. COVID-19 Testing Locations in the United States. Spatial dataset. {1}

p1.text: Read our most recent {0} to learn more about our project! You can find the source code for replicating the project on our {1}. All our data is open source and available upon request, via our Airtable database. Please don’t hesitate to reach out with any questions, concerns, or inquiries to {2}.

disclaimer.p: Our volunteer team collects and verifies data from diverse sources. We also help our partner organizations update their databases, and import them into our website. We strive to ensure our school meals database is 100% accurate and up-to-date, though we cannot guarantee we will not have errors. Soon, we will also include updated information on free food, legal aid, cash assistance, medical and mental health, child care, domestic violence support, housing, and COVID-19 testing resources, but these categories are a work-in-progress. We are working with our partners to bring together the best available information, keep it current, and share it in the most simple, helpful way.

spthanks.p: Special thanks to {0} and {1} for powering our site.

our-team.p1: We are a community of local students, alumni, and faculty from Stanford, USF, UC Berkeley, Palo Alto High School, Castilleja High School, Gunn High School, and Harker High School, and volunteers from Code for America’s local Code for San Jose chapter.

p2.text: We are immensely grateful to Joyce Tagal for her leadership in founding BAC; Maeva Fincker and our original developers, who built our custom UI in partnership with, and adapted from, the wonderful {0} team; Bill Behrman of the {1} for his sage guidance; Cheryl Phillips of {2} for her publicity support; students from the Stanford Future Bay Initiative, Stanford Sustainable Cities class, and Stanford Law COVID Pro Bono Program for their invaluable collaboration; and Open Referral and Mapbox for their technical support and advising.

dataaccess.p: You can access our data via an open project at {0} (login required).

ux_study.text_main: We want to learn more about what is top of mind for you at this time and get your input on how to improve the website.
ux_study.text_sub: If you are selected for interviewing,  all sessions will be conducted remotely via phone / video chat, and  we will compensate you for your time.
